narrative.title: First Italian Army - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: Italian Field Army deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Final defensive operations in Tunisia. Defense of Enfidaville Line against British Eighth Army advance from the south. Coordinated defense with German 5th Panzer Army to the north. Army conducted final delaying actions before Italian capitulation in Tunisia.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal Tunisia - mixed terrain including Enfidaville heights, olive groves, wadis, coastal plain

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Experienced defensive warfare from North Africa campaigns
Expertise in position warfare from Alamein experience
Coordination with German forces under unified Axis command

environment.terrain_type: Coastal Tunisia - mixed terrain including Enfidaville heights, olive groves, wadis, coastal plain
